definition[0]: a member of a team of young women who encourage a crowd to cheer at a US sports game by shouting special words and dancing
example[0]: She was a popular cheerleader at the University of Texas.
definition[1]: someone who encourages other people to do something
example[1]: She was our cheerleader, teacher, and friend.
definition[2]: someone who supports an idea, plan etc and tries to persuade other people to support it
example[2]: He was one of the biggest cheerleaders of economic globalization.
